subject: probability
title: Bayes' Theorem
contentHtml: Bayes' theorem is a fundamental concept in Bayesian inference that allows us to update our knowledge about a probability distribution based on new evidence.
intuition: This theorem shows us how to update our prior knowledge about a probability distribution based on new evidence, represented by the likelihood. It's like updating our mental model of the world based on new data.

subject: probability
title: Bayes' Theorem
contentHtml: Bayes' theorem is a fundamental concept in probability theory that allows us to update our beliefs about a random event based on new information.
intuition: This theorem provides a way to update our prior probability of an event given new evidence. It's like adjusting the weights in our mental scale based on new information.
realWorldApplications: Bayesian inference is used in natural language processing, image recognition, and other AI applications.
